thread.title: 'It's selfish if I talk about myself!' Garry Monk plays down prospect of signing new Leeds United deal
thread.title_full: 'It's selfish if I talk about myself!' Garry Monk plays down prospect of signing new Leeds United deal

author: David Anderson
title: 'It's selfish if I talk about myself!' Garry Monk plays down prospect of signing new Leeds United deal
text:
Sport 'It's selfish if I talk about myself!' Garry Monk plays down prospect of signing new Leeds United deal Monk’s one-year deal expires in June and the club have yet to open talks over new terms Share Garry Monk's one-year deal at Elland Road expires in June (Photo: Action Images) Share   
Garry Monk is determined not to let the uncertainty over his Elland Road future derail Leeds’ promotion bid. 
Monk’s one-year deal expires in June and the club have yet to open talks over new terms, despite co-owner Andrea Radrizzani insisting he wants him to stay. 
The former Swansea boss has transformed Leeds this season and fans are increasingly uneasy over the lack of progress over a new contract. 
Monk, 38, does not want speculation over his future to affect the team and says it would be “selfish” of him to discuss it at this key time. 
“I’m not going to talk about that situation, I don’t need to,” he said when quizzed about a new contract before today’s clash with QPR at Elland Road. Monk does not want to discuss his future as Leeds push for promotion (Photo: Leeds United) Leeds are flying high in the Championship (Photo: PA) 
“I think it’s selfish if I talk about myself. 
“Right now it’s about these players, this football club, trying to to win games. That’s the only bit. 
“You guys, I will tell you the first if there’s any news on that side of it, but that will obviously be when I have sat down and spoke to the club. 
“For me, it’s selfish of me to think about myself. It’s important that I think about my players and my staff and this club.” 
Monk sees today’s game as a measuring stick for Leeds’ progress under him after they were outclassed by Rangers 3-0 at Loftus Road on the opening weekend of the season. Former England goalkeeper Rob Green will make his 600th league appearance (Photo: Rex Features) 
Leeds are fourth, having won eight of their last nine league games at Elland Road, and Monk said: “We had a big disappointment on our opening day against QPR. 
“We felt we were better than what we showed. At the weekend we want to show how far we have come. We will have another big crowd and our passionate fans behind us.” 
Rob Green will make his 600th league appearance today and Monk praised the former England goalkeeper for his longevity after being written off. 
“It’s a fantastic achievement,” he said. “It just shows what a great professional he is and what a great career he’s had. 
“He has been vitally important. He’s a good goalkeeper and that’s why I wanted to bring him here.” poll loading Should Garry Monk sign a new deal at Leeds United? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
